Serialized Form

  • Package testing

    • Class testing.Attack extends javax.swing.JButton implements Serializable

    • Class testing.Battle extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • protagonist

          Protagonist protagonist
          the instance of the protagonist object in this class

        • enemy

          Enemy enemy
          the instance of the enemy object in this class

        • hitMeter

          HitMeter hitMeter
          the instance of the HitMeter object in this class

        • rand

          java.util.Random rand
          the random number generator to determine the enemy's attack power

        • protagonistImage

          javax.swing.JLabel protagonistImage
          the labels of the characters in the battle, which will be displayed on the dialog boxes

        • enemyImage

          javax.swing.JLabel enemyImage

        • bossImage

          javax.swing.JLabel bossImage

        • image

          java.awt.Image image
          used as a placeholder to obtain images that need to be resized

        • fixedImage

          java.awt.Image fixedImage
          used as a placeholder to hold images that are resized

    • Class testing.Ending extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • protagonist

          Protagonist protagonist
          this value holds the instance of the protagonist in this class

        • boss

          FinalBoss boss
          this value holds the instance of the protagonist in this class

        • protagonistLabel

          javax.swing.JLabel protagonistLabel
          this label holds the image of the protagonist

        • bossLabel

          javax.swing.JLabel bossLabel
          this label holds the image of the boss

        • animationTimer

          javax.swing.Timer animationTimer
          this timer determines when to continue the animation, stopping right after the "it was just a dream" dialog pops up. It sends a signal every 2 seconds.

        • leavingScreenTimer

          javax.swing.Timer leavingScreenTimer
          this timer determines the moments when the protagonist moves off the screen. It is enabled after the animationTimer is turned off, and sends a signal every 1 second.

        • animationCounter

          int animationCounter
          this value is checked everytime the animationTimer sends a signal, if it is enabled. It determines the part of the animation that should be played.

        • leavingCounter

          int leavingCounter
          this value is checked everytime the leavingScreenTimer sends a signal. It determines the distance the protagonist should be moving to the right, until he is offscreen.

    • Class testing.Enemy extends Mover implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • name

          int name
          number (essentially the name). Is the index of the object.

        • image

          java.awt.Image image
          when resizing sprites, this is the placeholder of the image that needs to be resized

        • fixedImage

          java.awt.Image fixedImage
          when resizing sprites, this is the placeholder of the new resized image that needs to be reassigned

        • enemyType

          java.lang.String enemyType
          determines movement and importance of enemy

        • enemyAttackPower

          int enemyAttackPower
          determines the damage the enemy will inflict on the protagonist during battle

        • enemyDefensePower

          int enemyDefensePower
          determines how much of the damage from the protagonist will be decremented during the battle when attacked by the protagonist

        • enemyPosition

          int[] enemyPosition
          holds the position of the enemy when it's moving around the room

        • enemyMovement

          javax.swing.Timer enemyMovement
          Controls movement of the enemy in the room. Sends a signal every 1 second.

        • steps

          int steps
          the steps when moving enemy in it's pattern

        • dir

          int dir
          subsitute direction the enemy is going

        • sprite

          javax.swing.ImageIcon[][] sprite
          creates an array of ImageIcons representing various states of the enemy

    • Class testing.FinalBoss extends Mover implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • sprite

          javax.swing.ImageIcon[][] sprite
          creates an array of ImageIcons representing various states of the boss

    • Class testing.IntroScreen extends javax.swing.JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • titleLabel

          javax.swing.JLabel titleLabel
          displays name of game

        • instructionLabel

          javax.swing.JLabel instructionLabel
          displays the first set of instructions on the intro screen panel

        • instructionsTimer

          javax.swing.Timer instructionsTimer
          timer that controls the blinking function of the instructions

        • instructionsCounter

          int instructionsCounter
          the counter that determines whether the instructions are visible or not 0 - let instructions appear, 1 - let instructions disappear

        • instructionFont

          java.awt.Font instructionFont
          contains font used for instructions label

    • Class testing.Mover extends javax.swing.JLabel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • row

          int row
          current position of Mover

        • column

          int column

        • dRow

          int dRow
          current direction (-1, 0, or 1) of Mover

        • dColumn

          int dColumn

        • healthPoints

          int healthPoints
          health points of Mover

    • Class testing.Protagonist extends Mover implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • battlePoints

          int battlePoints
          holds battle points of protagonist

        • won

          determine whether the protagonist won a battle or ran away

    • Class testing.Room extends javax.swing.JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields
